2021 Australian Infrastructure Plan

Publication Date: 02 September 2021

The 2021 Australian Infrastructure Plan is a practical and actionable roadmap for infrastructure reform.

The Plan is focused on reforms and policy recommendations that will deliver better infrastructure outcomes for Australian
communities.

Search the 20217 Australian Infrastructure Plan recommendations.

2021 Reform Priority List

 

 

 

Implementation and Progress

Detailed sector plans

We have produced detailed plans for all six infrastructure sectors, plus three cross-sector themes, to support the reform themes and
recommendations presented in the 2021 Australian Infrastructure Plan.

Designed for people working in a sector, or anyone with a keen interest in its future, each sector plan provides in-depth analysis,
reasoning and evidence to support the need for reform and the 29 recommendations.

Detailed plans are available in PDF format on request. Simply email us at engagement@infrastructureaustralia.gov.au indicating
which plan(s) you would like to receive, and we will reply as soon as possible.

Related links

Media release

Australian Infrastructure Audit 2019 »

The 2079 Australian Infrastructure Audit formed much of the evidence base for the Plan. The Plan presents to the
reform solutions to the challenges and opportunities identified in the Audit.

Progress since the 2016 Plan »

This report examines the progress of infrastructure reform since we released the 2016 Australian Infrastructure
Plan. The report finds that governments across Australia are at varying stages of progress against the
recommendations in the 2016 Plan.
